allsearch_api.title: Add Library Staff Search Endpoint to the API

comments.body:
Spoke with OIT's tech lead last week and OIT does not want to split this into a second API response and provide two API responses to every query we pass to the site because of rate limiting concerns on the cloud hosted solr provider for Drupal. Need to discuss possible options on our end. Here is what I see as the two choices:

1. Work out a caching solution that for a single query that isn't too painful for our API/frontend to deal with. 
2. Index staff data directly from what we get from the data warehouse similar to what we've implemented for best bets and databases.

@sandbergja and I discussed option two a bit in one our check-ins and were thinking scenario 2 was preferable. If there was any viable unique content from the website we wanted to incorporate into search results we could possibly as for a CSV report from the website we could pull regularly.
source data for scenario two would be the staff CSV we currently load into the Library Website from lib-jobs.

figgy.title: Characterization failures should record an error_message on FileSets.

comments.body:
Bugs to squash... 

1. Can't select the Tree widget folders via keyboard
2. Can't select the Gallery items via keyboard
4. Can't close modal via keyboard (keyboard trap)
5. Deleted TreeItem images should go back into the Unstructured Files bucket

Notes: 

1. When confirming deletion of folder with sub-items via keyboard, user must use spacebar to enter option
2. DeepZooming on both the Tree and the Gallery can be tricky. We want the key-command/shortcut to zoom on the selected item, but what if both are selected? Do we only allow one to be selected? Also, if we put the Zoom icon/button on the Gallery Item, as we do on the TreeItems, we need to change the Lux Gallery component to allow for zoom. This is better than the zoom being in the toolbar given keyboard navigation will make it hard to return focus to the toolbar.

From 10/26 Standup
- Do not allow Tree and Gallery items to be selected simultaneously. 
- Attach zoom button to Gallery card elements in Figgy (don't update Gallery in LUX)

orangelight.title: CDL Login Prompt delayed/not working at all for CDL items

comments.body: If we need another example: https://catalog.princeton.edu/catalog/99125533238106421. this one came in a recent catalog feedback ticket.

More information from Public services today, @kevinreiss : They tested a CDL book on a student's computer in Safari and when she clicked view digital content, the blue banner thing did not load at all. she switched to Chrome and it did appear, though very slow to appear in the blank gray screen. Can we check the different browsers as well?

I've checked Chrome, Firefox and Safari myself (on mac at least) and seen it appear very quickly in all three of them, other times it's very slow. I'm not sure this is a browser specific issue given the intermittent nature of the problem. It seems that fact it sometimes works fine, sometimes it takes forever to display, or even sometimes never renders suggests that the series of ajax actions that render the button perform very inconsistently.
Each CDL item seems to require four ajax actions to complete to display successfully. I think we need to drill into why we sometimes have a set of conditions where they don't succeed or take forever.

The first one from bibdata is an Alma api related action, where we've always seen a lot of variability in response time. That is what displays the link in the View Online section you click to see the button. That can definitely be slow, but haven't seen that fail.
Figgy ultimately renders the Blue Button, so I suspect at least one of the the actions marked "graphql" are ultimately not returning any data in some cases.
Id assume the alma related action can't really be improved re: speed/consistency. are we at the mercy of the host for that one?

The only way to improve it is to not do it. This would involve adding data about items on CDL to the index and working through the issues there that would arise with keeping it up to date. If we did do that this part of the content would render with the page itself.

Zero bytes files that are not migrated from pre-curation to post-curation should be noted in the Provenance Log

comments.body: I requested some clarification on this in [slack](https://pulibrary.slack.com/archives/C01555TP6HE/p1698333567439799)
From the discussion on slack (see above comment) we should be adding the zero length files not moving into the provenance log and not move the files.

Doing a bit of digging.  Directories are zero bytes and have a file name ending with `/` (`10.34770/zztk-f783/35/bitKlavierGrand_Binaural_44k16b/`) Files that are zero bytes do not have a filename that end with `/`(`10.11578/1562101/137/README.txt`)
It came back up at 3am.  Not sure what is up with that or how to find out.

I'd like to schedule a post-incident for this and see if we can figure out what happened.

Incident response document here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1rH5L5f44-MpuoEDusby10k8By-Rl8-4NlSVcsT9Y2nE/edit?usp=sharing

The call to `globus-connect-server endpoint show` on `pdc-globus-prod-postcuration` also returns the expected information (as opposed to hanging):

```
$ globus-connect-server endpoint show
Display Name:    Production PDC Postcuration
ID:              blah-blah-blah
Subscription ID: blah-blah-blah
Public:          True
GCS Manager URL: https://blah.blah.data.globus.org
Network Use:     normal
Organization:    Princeton University Library
Contact E-mail:  lsupport@princeton.edu
```

I've submitted a request to Globus support: https://support.globus.org/hc/en-us/requests/379037

Text below:

```
On 10/25/2023 at around 12 PM EST our Globus machine stopped responding. 
The endpoint for this machine is https://f0ad1.36fe.data.globus.org/api/info and 
was unresponsive

While the endpoint was unresponsive, running the command `globus-connect-server endpoint show` 
on the machine also timed out. 

The endpoint started responding again this morning 10/26/2023 around 3:17 AM EST.

Do you have any ideas if there was a larger issue happening that caused our endpoint to 
become unresponsive? Are the steps that we can take to diagnose the problem?

Could you add Francis Kayiwa (fkayiwa@princeton.edu) to this thread?
```

Globus reported that they did not have a outages on their end.

```
We don't track historical health data for given endpoints, 
so we're unable to answer questions in that vein.
 
With regards to questions regarding a potential Globus outage between 12PM EST 10/25/2023 and 
3:17AM EST 10/26/2023, we have no such records or reports.
 
This doesn't mean that there wasn't some larger issue at your site that could have interfered with 
connectivity for your endpoint, but we are unable to speak to such possibilities.
```

rdss-handbook.title: Update globus.md to add contact information

comments.body:
Creating 1000 projects in staging under the same namespace (e.g. `td-demo-001/project1...1000`) works rather well. Creating the projects took less than 2 minutes and queries come back within a few milliseconds

```
# 1,000 projects in staging

Creating 1000 projects with prefix oct26b...
Creating projects 163970.64 ms 163.98 seconds (~2 minutes)

Getting counts by data_sponsor zz001 160.13 ms 0.16 seconds
Getting counts by data_sponsor zz003 350.74 ms 0.36 seconds
Getting counts by data_sponsor zz007 660.79 ms 0.67 seconds
Getting counts by data_sponsor  100.60 ms 0.11 seconds

{:data_sponsor=>"zz001", :count=>"578"}
{:data_sponsor=>"zz003", :count=>"289"}
{:data_sponsor=>"zz007", :count=>"143"}
{:data_sponsor=>"total", :count=>"1015"}

Getting counts by data_sponsor zz007 department THREE 170.24 ms 0.17 seconds
47 records for data_sponsor zz007 department THREE
```

*Creating 10,000 projects under the same namespace on the other hand showed some problems*. It took about 30 minutes to create them (which is no big deal since we won't be creating 10,000 projects at once often) but the larger issue was that queries then started to take 1 to 2 seconds (rather than milliseconds).

```
# 10,000 projects in staging
Creating 10000 projects with prefix oct26c...
Creating projects 1861190.23 ms 1861.19 seconds (~30 minutes)

Getting counts by data_sponsor zz001 2350.55 ms 2.36 seconds
Getting counts by data_sponsor zz003 2350.05 ms 2.35 seconds
Getting counts by data_sponsor zz007 2310.55 ms 2.32 seconds
Getting counts by data_sponsor  1180.83 ms 1.19 seconds

{:data_sponsor=>"zz001", :count=>"6293"}
{:data_sponsor=>"zz003", :count=>"3146"}
{:data_sponsor=>"zz007", :count=>"1571"}
{:data_sponsor=>"total", :count=>"11015"}
Getting counts by data_sponsor zz007 department THREE 2300.85 ms 2.31 seconds
523 records for data_sponsor zz007 department THREE
```
